data.name: AboutButton
data.value: About the program

data.name: ApplicationTitle
data.value: Serbian-Orthodox Church Calendar

data.name: BlagovestiDesc
data.value: The Annunciation is the day when the Archangel Gabriel appeared to the Mother of God and told her that, through the Holy Spirit, she was in a blessed state and that she would give birth to a son.

data.name: BogorodiceDesc
data.value: One of the biggest Christian holidays of the Virgin Mary, celebrated every August 28, is marked with a red letter and represents the holiday of mothers and children.

data.name: BuyButton
data.value: Buy handmade icon

data.name: DescriptionTitle
data.value: Description

data.name: DurdicDesc
data.value:
Today marks the restoration of the temple of the Great Martyr George in Lydia and the transfer of the relics of Saint George to that temple.
An icon is used for Đurđić, which shows a soldier standing in a field with a spear in his hand.

data.name: KrstiteljaDesc
data.value: John was born six months before Jesus Christ, to father Zachary and mother Elizabeth, who were quite old at that time. According to tradition, the Archangel Gabriel appeared to the high priest Zachary in the Jerusalem temple and before announcing the conception of the virgin (the birth of Jesus Christ). he announced the conception of old Jelisaveta.

data.name: KrstovdanDesc
data.value: "Whoever is baptized with a cross, fasts on the Day of the Cross." that's what our people say. Two events are celebrated on this day.

data.name: LanguageTitle
data.value: Language

data.name: LazarevaSubotaDesc
data.value: Lazarus Saturday or Vrbica is prepared in the last week of Lent, for the biggest Christian holiday - Easter.

data.name: MarinaDesc
data.value: The feast of Saint Martyr Marina is popularly known as Fiery Mary. St. Marina was a great fighter for the Christian faith and the protection of women. People believe that St. Marina burns and punishes with fire, so she belongs to the "fiery" saints like St. Elijah.

data.name: PavlovdanDesc
data.value: On this day, the Orthodox Church and believers celebrate the Day of the Holy Apostles Peter and Paul, a holiday that is known in our people by the name - Peter's Day.

data.name: PreobrazenjeDesc
data.value: After three years of his preaching, Jesus Christ led his apostles James, Peter and John to Mount Tavor. During the following night, Jesus Christ was transformed in front of the apostles and became light.

data.name: PresveteBogorodiceDesc
data.value: The specific event that is commemorated and celebrated on that day happened according to Christian belief on October 1, 911, during the time of Emperor Leo the Wise (or the Philosopher). An all-night vigil was held in the Church of the Virgin Mary in Constantinople.

data.name: RodjenjeDesc
data.value: Mala Gospojina is a national holiday that celebrates the birth of the Virgin Mary. Many customs are associated with this holiday, and it is especially celebrated and respected by women.

data.name: SrdevdanDesc
data.value:
The holiday on which the day of Saints Sergius and Bacchus is celebrated in our nation is called Srđevdan.
Because of their Christian faith, Bacchus and Sergius were executed as Roman dignitaries at the court of Emperor Maximilian because they refused to bow down to the Roman gods.

data.name: SvetaMarijaDesc
data.value: She was born two millennia ago in the city of Magdala (Syria), after which she got her last name. According to tradition, Mary Magdalene was a sinner in her youth whom Jesus Christ saved from stoning.

data.name: SvetaParaskevaDesc
data.value:
In Serbia, our people often confuse Holy Friday Trnova (August 8) with Holy Friday (October 27).
The two saints are distinguished on the icons by the symbol of Saint Petka Trnova, the patroness of the blind, who holds a tablet with carved eyes in her hands.

data.name: SvetaPetkaDesc
data.value: Sveta Petka

data.name: SvetiAlimpijeDesc
data.value: Olympias was born in 522, and as a child he was given to the service of God. He served as a deacon of the Andrianapolitan bishop Theodore and learned the Holy Scriptures with him. Saint Olympias always tried to find ways to be alone, he always wanted to spend his life in prayer in solitude.

data.name: SvetiApostolPetarDesc
data.value: Peter was sleeping in prison, chained between two soldiers, and the night before he was brought to court, an angel woke him up and said to him: "Get up, put on your clothes and gird yourself, then come with me."

data.name: SvetiArandjelDesc
data.value: Saint Michael the Taxiarch is an archangel in Judaism, Christianity, Islam, and the Baha'i faith.

data.name: SvetiDimitrijeDesc
data.value:
In our nation, Mitrovdan represents one of the five greatest Serbian holidays.
This holiday is dedicated to the ancient commander Demetrius of Thessaloniki, who lost his life for the sake of the spread of Christianity.

data.name: SvetiGeorgijeDesc
data.value: The feast of Saint George, one of the nine great martyrs and the first martyrs for the Christian faith, is celebrated in all temples of the Serbian Orthodox Church and is one of the most common celebrations of Orthodox Serbs.

data.name: Svetih40mucenikaDesc
data.value: On March 22, Mladenci is celebrated. They are dedicated to the memory of the forty Martyrs of Sevasti, who died for the faith of Christ in the year 320.

data.name: SvetiIgnjatijeDesc
data.value: January 2 according to the modern calendar (December 20 according to the church calendar) is the feast of the baptism of Saint Ignatius the God-Bearer.

data.name: SvetiIlijaDesc
data.value: Saint Elijah is present in the Old and New Testaments as a prophet whose characteristics were taken over by Christianity, connecting him with the emergence of a new faith and the new coming of Christ.

data.name: SvetiJovanDesc
data.value: St. John is a model of honesty and righteousness, so in the Serbian people there is a custom that on Midsummer's Day people become brothers and godfathers "after God and St. John". Orthodox Christians celebrate the feast of the baptism of St. John, which is in third place in terms of the number of priests who celebrate, on January 20.

data.name: SvetiKirijakDesc
data.value: Michaelmas Day is a day dedicated to Saint Cyriacus the Hermit, popularly known as Saint Michael. There is a belief that the real autumn comes only after this holiday.

data.name: SvetiKnezLazarDesc
data.value: On June 28, the Orthodox Church and its believers celebrate Vidovdan, known as the date when the Battle of Kosovo took place and the feast of the holy martyrs Vid and Lazar Hrebeljanović.

data.name: SvetiLukaDesc
data.value: Christianity also teaches that he is the author of the third Gospel of the New Testament, around the year 60. He accompanied the apostle Paul on his missionary journeys, and later he preached himself

data.name: SvetiMarkoDesc
data.value: On that day, Saint Mark was executed in Egypt during the service of the liturgy in the Church of Alexandria. Saint Mark is one of the apostles (disciples) of Jesus Christ and the author of the second gospel.

data.name: SvetiNektarijeDesc
data.value:
In our nation, Mitrovdan represents one of the five greatest Serbian holidays.
This holiday is dedicated to the ancient commander Demetrius of Thessaloniki, who lost his life for the sake of the spread of Christianity.

data.name: SvetiNikolaDesc
data.value: Saint Nicholas or Nicholas Day, the most common holiday in Serbia, is celebrated on December 19, the day this saint died in 345 AD. They say that half of Serbia celebrates Saint Nicholas, and the other half goes to visit.

data.name: SvetiPanteljmonDesc
data.value: Saint Panteleimon or Saint Pantelia was born in Nicomedia. As a young man, he studied medicine and devoted himself to faith and Christ. There are many records of his miraculous healings.

data.name: SvetiStefanDecanskiDesc
data.value: Stefan Dečanski is one of the most tragic figures in the Nemanjić lineage. His tragic fate began in his youth when his father Milutin blinded him and sent him to prison in Constantinople. According to tradition and church teaching, after five years, Saint Nicholas restored King Stephen's sight.

data.name: SvetiStefanDesc
data.value: This day is also celebrated as the third day of Christmas for those who do not celebrate it. According to tradition, Stefan was the first of the seven deacons who were ordained by the holy apostles and appointed to serve the poor in Jerusalem. That is why he was called an archdeacon.

data.name: SvetiTomaDesc
data.value: Popularly known as "Unfaithful Thomas" because he refused to believe in the resurrection of Jesus Christ until he saw him himself and touched his nail wounds and put his hands in his ribs.

data.name: SvetiTrifunDesc
data.value: The Serbian Orthodox Church of St. Trifun celebrates February 14 according to the new calendar, or February 1 according to the old calendar. It is celebrated as the "Day of Love and Wine".

data.name: SvetiTriJerarhaDesc
data.value: The Holy Three Hierarchs are Saints Basil the Great, Gregory the Theologian and John Chrysostom, and each of them has its own day of celebration in the month of January.

data.name: SvetiVasilijeDesc
data.value: Today, the Serbian Orthodox Church and believers celebrate the feast of St. Basil of Ostrog, who is also called the Miracle Worker because of the healing powers of his relics and holy prayers.

data.name: SvetiVasilijeVelikiDesc
data.value: January 4th is the date of honoring Saint Basil, the Great Archbishop of Caesarea who was born around 329 during the reign of Emperor Constantine.

data.name: SvetogSaveDesc
data.value: He was known as the Enlightener, was a Serbian prince and Orthodox monk, the first Archbishop of the autocephalous Serbian Church, the founder of Serbian law, and a diplomat.

data.name: ToolTipGerman
data.value: German

data.name: ToolTipSerboCroatian
data.value: Serbocroatian

data.name: UsekovanjeDesc
data.value: St. John is known as someone who first announced the arrival of Jesus Christ on earth, and after his arrival baptized him in the Jordan River.

data.name: VavedenjeDesc
data.value: On this day, the memory of the first entry of the Virgin into the temple of God, accompanied by her parents Joachim and Anna, is celebrated. Namely, Maria was brought to the temple as a three-year-old child in accordance with her parents' vow that if they gave birth, they would hand over the child to God in the temple. In the festive procession, Maria walked between her mother and father, and many relatives and friends were moving behind them.
